comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: "In August 1914, the three Alice Rawson Schools for Mothers were taken over by the Government, and established as Baby Clinics. The first clinic was opened at 22 Henderson Road, Alexandria on August 24, 1914." - 'Beginnings of Organised Baby Health Clinics' in Our babies: the state's best asset - A history of 75 years of baby health services in New South Wales (Sydney : Media and Communications, NSW Health, 21 August 2003), p. 24 An interior shot of the Alexandria Baby Clinic: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3294509488/] The building still stands - Google Maps Street View
